summary: This document is an internal email forwarding a news article about UK regulators opening an investigation into Barclays CEO Jes Staley's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The investigation was triggered by emails provided by JPMorgan Chase to US regulators, which suggested a friendlier relationship than Staley had claimed. The document highlights regulatory scrutiny of financial executives' ties to Epstein.

events.description: Barclays publicly announced that UK regulators had commenced an investigation into CEO Jes Staley's characterization of his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: UK regulators opened an investigation into Barclays CEO Jes Staley after receiving emails from JPMorgan Chase that suggested his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein was friendlier than he had claimed.
The emails were provided by JPMorgan to US regulators, who then passed them to UK counterparts, triggering the investigation into whether Staley misled regulators.
Staley admitted to having a professional relationship with Epstein dating back to 2000 when he ran JPMorgan's private bank, but said it tapered off after 2013 and ended totally by late 2015.
Barclays conducted an internal review and concluded Staley had been sufficiently transparent about his relationship with Epstein, and the board retained full confidence in him.
The investigation focuses on whether Staley misled regulators through omission regarding the nature of his relationship with Epstein, which could impact his position as CEO.
